page.title: 07EDUCATION, LOWESWATER
page.content: There are no schools in this area. Between the ages of 4-11 most children go to school in the nearby village of Lorton. From the age of 11 unitl either 16 or 18, when they leave school, the children go mainly to Derwent Senior Secondary School in Cockermouth. There are eight children of school age, two between 4 and 11 years who go to Lorton, and four between 11 and 18 who go to Derwent. There are no special facillities in the area for the per-school children because of the very small numbers. However for these young children there is a Mothers and Toddlers group in Lorton. Most toddlers go between the ages of 2 and 4 years. For the older children there is a youth club, again in Lorton, for 11 years upwards and most of the children in the area go to this club.
